cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 230 mi E of Tampico, Mexico and 330 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander over the west-central Gulf through the weekend, then turn northwest toward the middle-to-upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Texas coast between Matagorda Bay and Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (interests along the W. Gulf should monitor)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf Coast from northern Mexico to south-central Louisiana, including the entire Texas coastline
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible – slow movement could lead to multi-inch totals
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible but too early to specify at Port Arthur
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind risk low (peak probability 4%); sustained winds most likely below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible if the system tracks closer to Upper Texas coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain bands could produce 4+ inches and localized flooding from Monday–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and short-period swell could disrupt vessel movements beginning late weekend
